meanings.sent1: The scared cat recules when it sees a big dog.
meanings.sent2: During the game, the team had to recule to defend their goal.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician recules into the audience, trying to escape his own trick.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the waves reculed, afraid of its power.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's training kicked in, causing him to recule from the enemy's sudden attack.

meanings.definition: The act of moving backward or retreating.
meanings.sent1: The recule of the army surprised the general.
meanings.sent2: In a dance performance, the recule of the dancers added a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent3: The recule of the car in the parking lot caused a small traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: The recule of the glacier revealed hidden treasures buried for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The recule of the tide left behind a trail of shells on the beach.
